com.netflix.spectator.impl

Class Config

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.netflix.spectator.impl.Config

  • public final class Config
extends Object
    Helper methods for accessing configuration settings.

    This class is an internal implementation detail only intended for use within spectator. It is subject to change without notice.

    • Method Detail

      • createProxy

        public static <T> T createProxy(Class<T> cls,
                                Function<String,String> props)
        Create a proxy class that implements the inferface specified.
        Parameters:
        cls - Interface that represents configuration settings.
        props - A function that maps a string key to a string value. This is the source of configuration settings. It is expected that the function is thread safe. The key used to lookup a value is the method name that is invoked on the interface.
        Returns:
        Instance of the interface that maps methods to the corresponding key in the props function.

      • usingMap

        public static <T> T usingMap(Class<T> cls,
                             Map<String,String> props)
        Create a proxy class that implements the inferface specified.
        Parameters:
        cls - Interface that represents configuration settings.
        props - Map storing the properties. It is expected that the map implementation is thread safe. The key used to lookup a value is the method name that is invoked on the interface.
        Returns:
        Instance of the interface that maps methods to the corresponding key in the props map.

      • usingProperties

        public static <T> T usingProperties(Class<T> cls,
                                    Properties props,
                                    String prefix)
        Create a proxy class that implements the inferface specified.
        Parameters:
        cls - Interface that represents configuration settings.
        props - Properties object storing the settings. The key used to lookup a value is the method name that is invoked on the interface.
        prefix - Prefix applied to the key before looking it up in the properties object.
        Returns:
        Instance of the interface that maps methods to the corresponding key in the props object.

      • usingSystemProperties

        public static <T> T usingSystemProperties(Class<T> cls,
                                          String prefix)
        Create a proxy class that implements the inferface specified. Data will come from System.getProperties().
        Parameters:
        cls - Interface that represents configuration settings.
        prefix - Prefix applied to the key before looking it up in the properties object.
        Returns:
        Instance of the interface that maps methods to the corresponding key in the props object.

      • usingMap

        public static RegistryConfig usingMap(Map<String,String> props)
        Create an instance of RegistryConfig backed by map. The map implementation should be thread-safe or not get modified after the config instance is created.
        Returns:
        Instance of RegistryConfig.

      • usingProperties

        public static RegistryConfig usingProperties(Properties props,
                                             String prefix)
        Create an instance of RegistryConfig backed by the provided properties object.
        Parameters:
        prefix - Prefix applied to the key before looking it up in the properties object.
        Returns:
        Instance of RegistryConfig.

      • usingSystemProperties

        public static RegistryConfig usingSystemProperties(String prefix)
        Create an instance of RegistryConfig backed by system properties.
        Parameters:
        prefix - Prefix applied to the key before looking it up in the properties object.
        Returns:
        Instance of RegistryConfig.

      • defaultConfig

        public static RegistryConfig defaultConfig()
        Returns a default implementation of the registry config backed by system properties.

      • propagateWarnings

        public static boolean propagateWarnings()
        Should an exception be thrown for warnings?

      • maxNumberOfMeters

        public static int maxNumberOfMeters()
        For classes based on AbstractRegistry this setting is used to determine the maximum number of registered meters permitted. This limit is used to help protect the system from a memory leak if there is a bug or irresponsible usage of registering meters.
        Returns:
        Maximum number of distinct meters that can be registered at a given time. The default is Integer.MAX_VALUE.
